Jean-NoÃ«l Rivasseau wrote:
> Hello,
> 
> I had a problem with encoding today and took a look at Heritrix code.
> Unfortunately it seems to me (from my understanding of the code) that
> Heritrix supports only ISO-8859-1 pages and UTF-8 pages. I have a page
> encoded in windows-1252, and Heritrix is not able to read it
> correctly.
> 
> Is better encoding support planned in the reasonable near future? This
> seems not a totally trivial thing to do (else I coul have tried) as
> the code is rather low level (ReplayCharSequence is probably the place
> that would need to be fixed) and I am not sure how to proceed.

Heritrix should already support many other encodings -- limited mainly 
by what support is in your Java VM.

As per HTTP/1.1, when no other charset is specified, ISO-8859-1 is 
assumed. See:

   http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec3.html#sec3.7.1

Can you be more specific about the problem you encountered? What did 
Heritrix not read that you tried?

- Gordon @ IA
